result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Braxton L Bronson

records.addlTxt:
Letter dated 10/10/2022, filed by Atty Kees, requesting an adjournment of the 10/13/2022 Hearing

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/11/2022 - Approved to set after 11/26/22.**

File not called on the record. 

9:00 AM Defendant Braxton L Bronson in court.  State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Patrick Sicula. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defendant is in DV treatment/classes, anticipated completion in in 4 months. Defense requests a date in about 45-60 days.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am. **Rescheduled due to a conflict with the Court's calendar.**

File not called on the record.
Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Braxton L Bronson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.    Defendant to have no contact with witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

09:47 AM Defendant Braxton L Bronson in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prior: 1311 Fleetfoot Dr,#202, Waukesha, WI 53186
